item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "The exhilarating ripple of her voice was a wild tonic in the rain." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I was enjoying myself now. I had taken two finger bowls of champagne and the scene had changed before my eyes into something significant, elemental and profound." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "You should never read just for "enjoyment." Read to make yourself smarter! Less judgmental. More apt to understand your friends' insane behavior, or better yet, your own. Pick "hard books." Ones you have to concentrate on while reading. And for god's sake, don't let me ever hear you say, "I can't read fiction. I only have time for the truth." Fiction is the truth, fool! Ever hear of "literature"? That means fiction, too, stupid." -- John Waters

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "We need to make books cool again. If you go home with somebody and they don't have books, don't fuck them." -- John Waters
